wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Hubert Nichols (28 November 1890 – 1 May 1952) was a British athlete who competed mainly in the Cross Country Team. He competed for Great Britain in the 1920 Summer Olympics held in Antwerp, Belgium in the Cross Country Team where he won the silver medal with his team mates James Wilson and Anton Hegarty.

At the International Cross Country Championships, Glover finished second to Jean Bouin in 1913, then third to Alfred Nichols and George Wallach in 1914.

Hegarty was born on 14 December 1892, in Derry, Ireland, the son of Isabel (Isabella) and John Hegarty. He competed for Great Britain at the 1920 Summer Olympics held in Antwerp, Belgium, in the Cross Country Team where he won the silver medal with his teammates James Wilson and Alfred Nichols after finishing fifth in the individual cross country event. He died in Rugby, England in 1944.

* Runner Alfred Nichols won gold at the International Cross Country Championships, held in Amersham, England. Team England also captured gold in the competition, which included 45 athletes from five countries.
